meanings.definition: Something that is of great importance or significance.
meanings.sent1: Finishing my homework on time was a biggie for me.
meanings.sent2: The presentation went well because I remembered all the biggies.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting my lunch at home was a biggie, but luckily a friend shared theirs with me.
meanings.sent4: The biggie of the day was when the principal announced a surprise field trip.
meanings.sent5: In the game of chess, protecting your king is a biggie to avoid losing.

meanings.definition: A person who is important or influential.
meanings.sent1: My teacher is a biggie in my life because they always support me.
meanings.sent2: The CEO of the company is considered a biggie by all the employees.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone wanted to talk to the biggie who arrived in a fancy car.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the wizard was the biggie who helped the hero on their journey.
meanings.sent5: The biggie in the movie industry won multiple awards for their outstanding performances.

meanings.definition: A large or significant event or occurrence.
meanings.sent1: The concert last night was a biggie with famous singers performing.
meanings.sent2: The wedding was a biggie for the couple as they had been planning it for months.
meanings.sent3: The biggie of the day was when the cat chased a squirrel up a tree.
meanings.sent4: In history class, we learned about the biggie battles that shaped the country.
meanings.sent5: Attending the championship game was a biggie moment for the young athlete.
